head.title: Metro Business Briefing; HARLEM RESTAURANT REOPENS

identified-content.org: Manna Soul Food & Salad Bar (NYC Restaurant)
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Hospitality, Restaurant and Travel

hedline.hl1: Metro Business Briefing; HARLEM RESTAURANT REOPENS

abstract.p: Manna Soul Food & Salad Bar, on Frederick Douglass Boulevard and 125th Street in Harlem, reopens this month after undergoing $500,000 expansion; photo (S)

block.p: Manna Soul Food & Salad Bar, on Frederick Douglass Boulevard and 125th Street, reopened this month after undergoing a $500,000 expansion. Located opposite the new Harlem U.S.A. shopping center, the restaurant opened in 1983 as the tiny B & R Barbecue, named for its owners, Betty and Rick Park, immigrants from Korea. Now expanded to two floors, the cafeteria-style restaurant -- one of the few alternatives to fast food on 125th Street -- can seat 90 people. Several new restaurants have opened in Harlem recently, including Amy Ruth's, at 116th Street between Lenox and Seventh Avenues; Bayou, on Lenox Avenue between 125th and 126th Streets; Londel's Supper Club, on Frederick Douglass between 139th and 140th Streets; and Miss Maude's, on Lenox Avenue between 137th and 138th Streets.

Located opposite the new Harlem U.S.A. shopping center, the restaurant opened in 1983 as the tiny B & R Barbecue, named for its owners, Betty and Rick Park, immigrants from Korea. Now expanded to two floors, the cafeteria-style restaurant -- one of the few alternatives to fast food on 125th Street -- can seat 90 people. Several new restaurants have opened in Harlem recently, including Amy Ruth's, at 116th Street between Lenox and Seventh Avenues; Bayou, on Lenox Avenue between 125th and 126th Streets; Londel's Supper Club, on Frederick Douglass between 139th and 140th Streets; and Miss Maude's, on Lenox Avenue between 137th and 138th Streets.
